review_blob:
On tap at Via Via Cafe for the official unveiling. Served extremely cold, might not have helped.
Aroma has a caramel nose and the usual hops. Appearance is nice and dark. This beer packs a strong punch in bitterness, both from the hops and from the roasted malt. It tasted a little too "burned" for me. Not as refined as it could have been, hopefully the great guys at BBP can improve it!

What a disappointment. Its a very uninteresting beer, with little flavour and not even a hint of bitterness to make it at least refreshing.
A waste of a drink, Im afraid.
The only redeeming quality is the low alcohol content, making it OK to drink if you dont want to get sloshed.

Bottle at home, bought directly at De Ranke.
Pours a lovely orange with nice head disappearing quickly.
Aroma is very hoppy, as you would expect.
The bitterness of the beer is great and balanced by the malts. After every sip the bitterness lingers on the tongue inviting to go back for more.
Very fizzy with a bitter finish.
Absolutely great.

Bottle at Schoenbuch Biergarten in the center of Stuttgart. Served very cold, so maybe I missed some of the aroma.
The beer pours with little head and a lovely dark amber color. The choice of glass is also perfect.
Citrusy notes are strong, but not much else comes to the nose.
Not very bitter, it kind of lost some appeal after the first few sips, not giving that need to go back for more common to many PAs.
Its advertised as a German version of an American Pale Ale, and I can see why, but the low hops let the beer down for me.

Bottle from Malting Pot. Pours a hazy golden yellow with white persistent head. Not much aroma to be honest, but whats there is citrusy and inviting. The first sip is sweet, with hops quickly following. Bitterness lingers on the tongue inviting for another sip. Repeat. Deliciously easy to drink, I can see this being a real hit on a hot summer day.

Bottle from Malting Pot. Pours a beautiful dark color with a persistent creamy head. A delicious mix  between a stout and an IPA. Roastiness of the dark beer plus hoppiness make this beer refreshing but still tasty.
beer_name: De la Senne Black in Japan

review_blob: On tap at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Beautiful red color with little head, intense hoppy aroma. Very bitter taste with hops just overwhelming everything else. Im not even sure what else one is supposed to be tasting, but the final effect is brilliant with its astringent finish that just makes you go for another sip. Very very nice.

On tap at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Dark, no, Black with a nice creamy head. The smokiness is strong in this one. Roasted cereals come to mind. As others have said, it is delicious but quite a challenge to drink more than one. Definitely a beer you have to nurse for a fair amount of time.

Bottle #4053 of the 2011 Mega Blend production. This blend has been bottled in October 2010. 75cl bottle.
Aroma is very citrusy, and the beer pours with plenty of head in an orange and clear way. Sourness is just what youd expect, but its not bitter and its very very pleasant. Very carbonated, with a bit of an astringent finish. My girlfriend, who hates geuze, thinks it has a Brut Champagne-y finish and I agree, its very very pleasant.
It continues in the 2009 tradition, exceptional Geuze that for me rivals with Mariage Parfait.
